data.name: label85.Text
data.value: The default region for maps of multiple occultation paths, and lunar grazing occultations, is usually determined from the parameters used to select events to plot. Here you can specify commonly used 'fixed' regions to plot. You can also set the first region as the initial plot region for grazing occultation maps.

data.name: label97.Text
data.value: A number of functions in Occult are not intended for general use. They include the routines for reporting observations to the Minor Planet Center, editing the files of XZ double and variable stars, and manipulating the NOMAD catalogue. They also include the routines for collecting lunar occultation observations. You should NOT enable these functions unless you have a specific need. Please note that if you enable these functions and 'play around' with them to see what they do, you may corrupt important files and lose functionality.

data.name: label74.Text
data.value: NOTE: Several data files used by Occult can be updated using 'Anonymous' ftp download. Anonymous FTP requires a password, which is usually your email address. Note that the default password used in browsers such as Netscape and Mozilla will NOT work on the Minor Planet Center site. Enter your email address above for use with Anonymous FTP downloads.

data.name: label182.Text
data.value: Maximum number of events allowed to be computed or loaded [The recommended value is 20,000. The performance of the program will slow down as the number of events increases. If this value is too large, the program may run out of memory]

data.name: label184.Text
data.value: The UCAC4 catalogue has files in two duirectories - u4b and u4i. The files in u4b contain the catalogue data, while those in u4i provide indexes and cross-references. Apart from use with the UCAC4 catalogue, the files in u4i are used when accessing the Occult Gaia catalogue using UCAC4 numbers. For this reason, these files are essential to Occult.
